description: Simple web components for all of your web application needs.

values.name: body
values.description: The main colour for the site, used for the body background colour.

values.name: headline
values.description: Background from the body colour but with a darker text so as to stand out.

values.name: surface
values.description: For blocks to stand out from rest of the document body. Should still be part of the document flow. Useful for things like cards and inputs.

values.name: contrast
values.description: The opposite of surface. Part of the standard document flow but darker and normal text colour. Should be used for aside content.

values.name: primary
values.description: The primary theme colour for the site. Should be used for most buttons and interactive content. Normally used for the site header.

values.name: warning
values.description: Normally red. Used to indicate issues that require the immediate attention of the user. Normally form submission errors.

values.name: rainbow_0
values.description: Rainbow colours are for more flexible or designed content. Good for graphics, syntax highlighting, and the like.

values.name: rainbow_1
values.description: Rainbow colours are for more flexible or designed content. Good for graphics, syntax highlighting, and the like.

values.name: rainbow_2
values.description: Rainbow colours are for more flexible or designed content. Good for graphics, syntax highlighting, and the like.

values.name: rainbow_3
values.description: Rainbow colours are for more flexible or designed content. Good for graphics, syntax highlighting, and the like.

values.name: rainbow_4
values.description: Rainbow colours are for more flexible or designed content. Good for graphics, syntax highlighting, and the like.

values.name: rainbow_5
values.description: Rainbow colours are for more flexible or designed content. Good for graphics, syntax highlighting, and the like.

values.name: rainbow_6
values.description: Rainbow colours are for more flexible or designed content. Good for graphics, syntax highlighting, and the like.

values.name: rainbow_7
values.description: Rainbow colours are for more flexible or designed content. Good for graphics, syntax highlighting, and the like.

values.name: rainbow_8
values.description: Rainbow colours are for more flexible or designed content. Good for graphics, syntax highlighting, and the like.

values.name: rainbow_9
values.description: Rainbow colours are for more flexible or designed content. Good for graphics, syntax highlighting, and the like.

values.name: _self
values.description: the current browsing context. (Default)

values.name: _blank
values.description: usually a new tab, but users can configure browsers to open a new window instead.

values.name: _parent
values.description: the parent browsing context of the current one. If no parent, behaves as `_self`.

values.name: _top
values.description: the topmost browsing context (the "highest" context that's an ancestor of the current one). If no ancestors, behaves as `_self`.

values.name: none
values.description: No virtual keyboard. For when the page implements its own keyboard input control.

values.name: text
values.description: Standard input keyboard for the user's current locale.

values.name: decimal
values.description: Fractional numeric input keyboard containing the digits and decimal separator for the user's locale (typically . or ,). Devices may or may not show a minus key (-).

values.name: numeric
values.description: Numeric input keyboard, but only requires the digits 0-9. Devices may or may not show a minus key.

values.name: tel
values.description: A telephone keypad input, including the digits 0-9, the asterisk (*), and the pound (#) key.

values.name: search
values.description: A virtual keyboard optimized for search input. For instance, the return/submit key may be labeled "Search", along with possible other optimizations.

values.name: email
values.description: A virtual keyboard optimized for entering email addresses. Typically includes the @character as well as other optimizations.

values.name: url
values.description: A keypad optimized for entering URLs. This may have the / key more prominent, for example. Enhanced features could include history access and so on.

values.name: button
values.description: Use if the button should do nothing and you intend to handle click events for yourself.

values.name: submit
values.description: Use if the button is within a `form` tag and you intend for the button to submit said form.
